Posts.Title: does it require symptoms Polyana Mazy1959

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2012 08:49AM Polyana wrote: Shanagirl, If you don't worry then something is wrong. As long as you worry you are healthy. But having said that, you need to rationalise your thinking, and order stuff in your mind. You worry when you are dam sure something is wrong, but what you are doing right now is anxiety that does you no good. I had a chest X-Ray and the report said Polumonary nodule of 0.5 cm I almost feeaked out, cried, and di all the drama in the world, but it did me no good. You need to calm down, excercise, work on mind therapy and tell yourself you are fine, nothing is wrong with you, smile, laugh instead of crying, pray, let this negative energy of thoughts out of you, and you will be in peace. Whatever it is (and I pray it will be nothing serious) we don't have anything in our hands to do, all we can do is get treatment, and pray it works well for us. Hugs coming your way

Posts.Content: Polyana wrote: Hi all, you need to congratulate me, I had my 1st chemo session and now I am on the 2nd week waiting for one more to go before I get my 2nd chemo session this month. I did have some side effect issues on the day of the infusion but was managable. The 1st day was great I thought, each person has his own experience since I did not feel anything, even my doctor was surprised it was only the 3rd day when I developed a flew like symptoms and then FEVER, it went up to 104 and they had to rush me to the ER. ever since that day till today I am feeling sick first it was flew, then fever, then mouth sores, and an UGLY taste in my mouth. I don't know how to get it away, it is preventing me from eating, and drinking and I know I have to get my energy up for the coming battle. As well I have like a stabbing pain right on my heart, it comes and goes, for a moment I thought it is a heart attack, and now a sever pain in my upper right leg. Could this relate to the chemo? So I want to ask: How do I get rid of this taste and mouth sores, I had difficulty talking because it hurts so bad. Is it true that vitamine C is not good with chemo as it reduces the power of chemo. So I can not take like boost fruit drinks! I have been told that herbs are not good woth chemo, where do I find the lost of herbs of the yes and no herbs with chemo thing? Is it OK that I use vitamine E oil for my skin or other oils to moisture my skin? How do I keep myself active and energized that is what my doc told me? but how? Thanks Dx 3/24/2010, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, 2/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Polyana wrote: Do forgive me for putting such a post and asking such a question. In one of my chemo sessions when I was soo afraid and in the peek of my anxiety, a man was sitting next to me taking his dose, he told me that he has been diagnosed since 2002, and cancer has been visiting different sites in his body and now he is fighting it in his lungs1! He told me to stand for it, fight and never loose hope and faith. When I went back home, I asked myself, I read about chemo and how strong it is to kill the cancer cells. It does allot to our bodies, hair falls, vomiting...tired, pain..etc and above all we keep out strength and we welcome all the bad things it does just coz we know this unpleasant guest has a good job to do, its like a home made who cleans the dust and dirt. That Y we are so acceptable. So I asked myself, despite all that it does in our bodies, Y does cancer come back after a while, or after some long time? Why does it come back in a diff. place? Y does it let us rest for a while and come back again? so does that mean the chemo did not work, or is it a temp. effect. I asked my doctor and he said NO cancer can be cured. Not sure if he said that for hope or for a strong belief of his. I have a friend of mine who has been diagnosed with BC, and she came back from her treatment and her family did celebrate. I was happy for her, but a friend of mine said (Y r u happy, poor thing it is cancer, it will come back again..there is no cure that's why it is called the wicked devil).. Apologies if this post might casue frustrations to some but it does for me as well, I just want to share my thoughts, and worries and find some answers. Dx 3/24/2010, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, 2/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

I am ER+ (90%) PR+ (70%) HER2-NEU: Not overexpressed (what does that mean would any one tell me please) I was told I need to do PET scan for the body, or maybe a breast MRI to check the nipple since the doctor is concerned that my nipple would be involved. Now I have to start Chemo therapy: I need you to share with me your experience; what should I ask the doctor about, and what should I know from him. How do I know that chemotherapy is right for me, how do I know or they know that those medications are effective? What about the PORT!! I am soooo scared of the procedure specially that I have issues with general anesthetic. Does it have to be in the neck! What do I expect during the chemo treatment, will I vomit, skin rash, heart problems, breezing problems. How long will I take it and how frequent R there any standardized medical procedure that I need to be aware of or ask about before getting my treatment Can they provide me with a nutritionist to help me with the food stuff that is good for me ..etc Will I be supervised by a doctor during the chemo session, will I stay overnight at the hospital. Who take care f me or looks after me during that time. How long a chemo session takes Finally after all those desperate questions: Is it effective to shrink the tumor size? How fast or how effective before surgery. I am afraid that I am stage 3 -not sure if it gone somewhere else. I am so desperate, and I do not want to be a victim for not knowing or understanding the -/+ of this issue. To where this road is taking me..... Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2010 07:05AM Polyana wrote: Dear all, After living with these symptoms for 3 years without any impact or change in lump, breast size, shape...etc I went and had a FNAC and never in my thoughts had I thoughts of anything negative. I did the FNAC and the report says: Gross pathology: an ill defined firm mass at the right retro-areolar region, with ulcerated crusted nipple. The nipple was dry. The mass was aspirated for cytology. The aspirate was moist.  CYTOLOGY: Smears of the aspirate showed cellular pattern, made up of irregular clusters of loosely cohesive ductal epithelial cells with moderate cellular atypia. Sporadic similar cells are also seen. Few inflammatory cells are observed. DIANGOSIS: Right retro-areolar breast mass, fnac of highly atypical ductal cells favoring cytologic malignancy suggestive for invasive duct carcinoma. comment: it is a rule that cytologic malignancy is to be documented by biopsy and tissue diagnosis with or without frozen section Please correlate with the clinical radiologic findings and serum level of tumor markers I did a chest x-ray that said A well defined round shaped, opacity is seen projecting in the right lung base in the P.A view which is not well appreciated in the lateral view mostly representing the shadow of the nipple Clear both lung fields and costophernic angles Normal cardiace size and configuration I did an ultra sound that said: There is R breast well defined hypoechic smooth margins 2.3 X1.6 with horizontal merit. Picture of benign lesions. Free axillary's lymph nodes Other abdomen, pelvic and stomach pictures are clean. I did a full blood test and urine which all came normal and clean too. My treating doctor is insisting that I do not have IC. The other doctors whom I traveled to, believe I need to act quickly and do the surgery... I am caught by surprise; I do not know what to do and do not know where to take it from. Therefore I need the support of all the readers in this forum to help me and guide me, especially those who have passed by this experience. I look for the support, patience, guidance and assistance from all of you. Please do not hesitate to share with me any piece of info that would be useful. I am afraid of the next step, do those results mean a definit answer. Or surgery will rule out something else. Do I need to do an MRI...What chances do I have. As well I am afraid about the type of surgery can it be lumpectomy if the mass is less than 5 cm on local anesethia. I read it can be done on local anesethia, as I have phobia issues to this matter. What about sex life, how do you manage it. It is really difficult, and I don't know what to do about it or how to handle it. Last point: have any of you passed by the SARAH curve. I was totally SHOCKED, was screeming, yelling and crying. I was in anxiety and panic sooo much, then I started accepting it and now I am so calm and so cold to an extent as if I do not care!!! Is this normal

Posts.Title: February 2011 Rads ToriGirl Elisimo

Posts.Content: Polyana wrote: Dear all, I received my FNAB report which I did on 24th March 2010 1) FNA of right breast lump situated retroareolar ,FNA was done using 23G needle and gives soft and gritty needle sensation.( FNA was difficult patient not cooperative) Microscopic examination revealed a cellular specimen showing many groups of malignant duct cells with hyperchromatic pleomorphic nuclei and prominent nucleoli and increase in nucleocytoplasmic. They are arranged mainly in large clusters, and many monolayered sheets of malignant cells devoid of myoepithelial cells suggesting evident in situ component in a necrotic background of tumour diathesis. Picture is consistent with well differentiated adenocarcinoma (Invasive duct carcinoma) with evident in situ component 2) Review of the slide delivered by the patient from previous FNA confirmed the previous diagnosis DIAGNOSIS: FNA RIGHT BREAST LUMP: WELL DIFFERENTIATED INVASIVE DUCT CARCINOMA N.B: Surgical interference with frozen section is mandatory for confirmation I want to ask: What should my next step be? What does this report mean? Has any one past through this experience? What are my treatment options? Any statistics for survival? Thanks Dx 3/24/2010, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, 2/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My FNAB results Polyana debbie6122

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2010 12:30PM Polyana wrote: Hi all and happy thanksgiving. My sugery is on Dec 2nd, I had the option of Nov 18th but freeked out and thought I am not ready!!! Imagin someone else would cry to have an early date. I guess I am kind of different. I am starting to have sleepless nights. My sisters are coming over this Sunday to support me and stay with me till the end of this tough adventure if I can say. I am worried, and not doing anything apart from praying that all goes well. I will have a modified radical mastectomy. Worried about the surgery, anaesethia risk and side effects, recovery, pain..etc I really wish this will end up Good enough for all of us. You all take care and best wishes for a speedy recovery and a healthy life afterwards, and we all wake-up and find that the nightmare is OVER
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Polyana wrote: Met my Dr. yesterday to discuss my pathology report. I am stage 3b. I was told my tumor is 3.5 cm, it is grade 2, only 2 lymph nodes involved out of 6. But I was told it is found in some nodes or cells related to the skin, and he told me we need to watch for that. I undertand the whole of the 1st part but the last is I don't. What does that mean, how aggressive is it and will it not respond to treatment or the likelyhood of coming back is high...anyone help Dx 3/24/2010, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, 2/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: In a state of shock Polyana paml

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2010 01:04PM Polyana wrote: whatisthis and layla hope every thing is going very well with you. I am schedualed to see a new surgeon next week Monday, and very worried hoping that my symptoms are just B9. I have a nipple issue, i did not do a punch biopsy, I did FNAB and scrap biopsy for the crust. I am really freaked out because of paget's disease. Any one who can share their symptoms, and treatments. Is it followed by radiation and chemo, or just a simple mastectomy..look at me always thinking about the worse!!
Posts.Title: Pathology Back....Help Needed layla26 Polyana

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2011 02:25PM Polyana wrote: Hi all, Just to let you know I did the surgery on Dec 3rd. I am fine, and started chemo again+ rad. My greetings to all of you out there who had there surgery in Dec 2010, happy new year and best wishes for you all. Hope to hear good news about you all
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2010 07:49AM Polyana wrote: Hi all, For how long have you been experiencing these symptoms. You know how I feel about my self at the moment.. I feel like I am a homeless person knocking on the doors of other asking for help, asking for comfort and security.... I have been like this for 3 years, and I am lost. I have a nipple crust, scaling, and eczema like thing for 3 years till now. I did a biopsy but not on the nipple, it went right into the nipple deeper in the breast. It was very painful. And they scraped the nipple crust on the surface. They say: mildly atypical cells however the cromatine pattern does not look malignant. Nipple ulcer with sign of subereolar papilomatosis. I am really worried and not sure about the next step. What if I have PD, how would I deal with it. I am very phobic and have issues of anxiety and depression. I need a piece of mind.
Posts.Title: Nipple/areola biopsy- spoke to Dr. GRB Polyana
